description: ERECTION OF A TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION TO THE WESTERN END OF THE BUILDING TO PROVIDE 2 X 2 BEDROOM FLATS, A ROOF EXTENSION INVOLVING RAISING THE RIDGE OF THE ROOF AND THE ERECTION OF 2 X REAR DORMER WINDOWS AND 2 X FRONT GABLES TO PROVIDE 1 X 2 BEDROOM FLAT, A TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION TO THE EASTERN END OF THE BUILDING TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO THE 2ND FLOOR ROOF FLAT, TOGETHER WITH ASSOCIATED ACCESS, CAR PARKING AND LANDSCAPING
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The developments to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Particulars and samples of the materials to be used on all external faces on the building, including fenestration, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works are commenced. Development shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 3 - Details of those parts of the site not covered by buildings including any parking, service roads, sight lines, footpaths, hard and soft landscaping, surface treatment and boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any development hereby permitted commences. These works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 4 - Details of proposals for the storage and disposal of refuse shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development commences. These facilities shall be provided in full accordance with the approved details before any permitted use starts and permanently maintained thereafter.

Condition : 5 - Before the extensions hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the north east flank elevation building shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 6 - No demolition or construction work in pursuant of this permission shall be carried out on or before 08.00 hours or after 1800 hours on Mondays to Fridays inclusive, before 0800 hours or after 1300 hours on Saturdays and at no time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 7 - The garages and car parking spaces as shown on the approved drawing 460/11.5C shall be provided before commencement of the use of the land or buildings hereby permitted and thereafter shall be kept free from obstruction and shall not be used for purposes other than the parking of a vehicle in conjunction with the development hereby permitted.

Condition : 8 - Details of cycle parking facilities (and disabled car parking bays) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development and shall be installed prior to the occupation of buildings hereby approved and permanently maintained thereafter.

Condition : 9 - The tree planting/landscaping scheme, which should include full details of species, size of plants and spacing shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval and be implemented during the next planting season after the completion of the building operations on site, or within any such longer period as may be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. The Council will require a maintenance period of 3 years during which dead, dying or defective trees, shrubs and ground cover must be replaced.
Condition : 10 - The trees shown on the deposited plan 460/11.5C to be retained, shall be retained and maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 11 - Any tree shown for retention, which is identified as being dead, dying, dangerous or mutilated, within three years from the completion of building works, thereby needing to be removed, shall be replaced by a semi-mature or mature tree of the same species or a tree of height, girth and species to be agreed with the Local Planning Authority. The replanting shall take place in the first available planting season.

Condition : 12 - No preparatory works, site clearance or other building operations shall commence until a plan, showing the method and means of tree/shrub/hedgerow protection has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 13 - The use of the building hereby approved shall not take place until such time as details of access for disabled persons has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and installed in accordance with the approved details and permanently maintained thereafter.

Condition : 14 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is reminded to seek the consent of the Council's Highway Authority in respect of the provision of a footway crossover, which can only be installed by the highway authority at the owner's expense. The applicant is advised to contact Marie Remedios on 020 8545 3220.
